definitions.title: indef.
definitions.body: what ? how ? aught; used of things, as [[מִי]] of persons (Aram. mo0, [[מָא]], Ar. ma0; prob. apoc. from a longer form with n or nt, As. minû (Dl:HWB 417 f.), Eth. mnt: ment; cf. W:CG 123 ff. K?:ii. 368):—
interrog. what ?

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: in a direct question, before either verbs or nouns Ge 4:10 [[מֶה עשׂית]] what hast thou done ? Ge 15:2 [[מה־תתן־לי]] what wilt thou give me ? Ex 3:13 [[מַה־שְּׁמוֹ]], Ex 12:26, Ex 13:14 and so very often: [[מַה־הִיא]] Zec 5:6; [[מה אלה]] Zec 1:9; [[מָה אַתָּה רׂאֶה]] Je 1:11, Am 7:8 + ; Joe 4:14 [[מה אתם לי]]; Ju Jdg 18:8 [[מה אתם]] vid. Comm., v:Jdg 18:24 [[מה לי עוד]] what have I still ? Is 21:11 [[מה־מלילה]] what (= how much) of the night (is past) ? = as what ? (qualem ?) Hag 2:3 (cf. [[מִי]] Am 7:2); to express surprise, Job 9:12 who shall say to him, [[מה תעשׂה]] what doest thou ? Job 22:13, Ec 8:4, Is 45:9, Is 45:10; sq. [[כִּי]], Ge 20:10 [[מה ראית כי עשׂית]] what hadst thou in view, that thou hast done, etc.? Ge 31:36, Ex 16:7 [[וְנַחְנוּ מָה כִּי]] and what are we, that…? Ex 32:21, Nu 22:28, Hb Hab 2:18, etc. Note in partic.—(a) [[מָה]] is followed sometimes by a subst. in appos. (against Arabic usage, which does not permit this: W:AG. ii. § 170), so that it becomes virtually an adj.: [[מַה־בֶּחַע]] what profit…? Ge 37:26, Ps 30:10, Mal 3:14; Is 40:8 [[מַה־דְּמוּת]], Mal 1:13, Ps 89:48 [[זְכָר־אֲנִי מֶה חָָלֶד]] (inverted for [[חֶלֶד אָָנִי מַה]]) remember (of) what (short) duration I am, Ec 1:3, Ec 5:10, Ec 5:15, Ec 6:8, Ec 6:11 (Da:§ 8, R. 2 K?:iii. 23 f.); as exclam., Ps 89:48 b, Job 26:14. And with the subst. idiom. at the end (in Arabic preceded then by mino: W:AG. ii. § 49. 7), 1Sa 26:18 [[ומַה־בידי רעה]] and what is there in my hand, evil ? 1Sa 20:10 (vid.
), 2Sa 19:29, 2Sa 24:13, 1Ki 12:16, Je 2:5 [[מה־מחאו אבותיכם בי עָוֶל]], Ec 11:2, Es 6:3. (b) [[מַה־זֶּה]] what now ? 1Sa 10:11, contr. [[מַזֶּה]] † Ex 4:2 ([[זֶה]]

definitions.title: 4 c
definitions.body: ); Ge 3:13 [[מַה־זּאׁת עָשִׂיתָ]]; Ge 12:18, Ge 29:25 [[מַה־זּאׁת עָשִׂיתָה לִּי]]; similarly Ge 26:10, Ge 42:28 + , either what, now, hast thou done ? or what is this  that thou hast done ? (vid. [[זֶה]]

definitions.title: 4 d
definitions.body: ). (c) [[לְּ ְמַה־]] what to thee ? i.e. what aileth thee ? or what dost thou want ? Ge 21:17 [[מַה־לָּךְ הָגָר]]; Jos 15:18, 2Sa 14:5, 1Ki 1:16, 2Ki 6:28, Ez Eze 18:2 (accents); sq. [[כִּי]], Ju Jdg 18:23 [[מה־לך כי נזעקת]], Ge 20:9 (cf. 1Sa 11:5 [[לעם כי יבכו מה]]), Is 22:1 [[מַה־לָּךְ כִּי עָלִיתְ]] (cf. ti/ paqw\n, tou=to poiei=v;), Ps 114:5; without [[כִּי]] Is 3:15 (cf. Qor 57:8, Is 57:10); with a ptcp., Jon 1:6 what is it to thee as a sleeper ? (accus.: Da:§ 70 a cites Qor 74:50), Ez Eze 18:2 (if [[אתם]] be treated as strengthening [[לכם]]). (d) [[פׂה]] ([[לִי]]) [[מַה־לְְּ]] = what hast thou (have I) here ? Ju Jdg 18:3, 1Ki 19:9, Is 22:16, Is 52:5. (e) in the genit., Je 8:9 [[וְחָכְמַת־מֶה לָהֶם]], and wisdom of what (= what kind of wisdom) is theirs ? Nu 23:3 (v. infr.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: often in an indirect question, as after [[ראה]], Ge 2:19 to see [[מה־יקרא־לו]] what he would call it, Ge 37:20 [[וְנִרְאֶה מה־יהיו חלֽמׂתיו]] to what his dreams will come, Nu 13:19 f. Hb Hab 2:1; [[הִכִּיר]] Ge 31:32; [[ידע]] Ge 39:8, Ex 2:4 [[לדעת מה־יֵּעָשֶׂה לו]], Ex 16:15, Ex 32:1, Job 34:4; [[שׁמע]] Nu 9:8 ´[[וְאשׁמעה מה־יחוה י]] (cf. Ps 85:9), 2Sa 17:5; [[פּׂרַשׁ]] Nu 15:34; [[שׁאל]] 1Ki 3:5, 2Ki 2:9; [[הֵבִין]] Job 6:24, Job 23:5: Nu 13:18 [[מה היא וראיתם את הארץ]], Ps 39:5, Is 41:22 [[הראשׁנות מָה הֵנָּה הַגִּידוּ]].—In some such cases it approximates in meaning to the simple rel., as Je 7:17, Je 33:24, Mic 6:5, Mic 6:8, Job 34:33.

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: = of what kind ? (Germ. was für ein ... ?), with an insinuation of blame, or reproach, or contempt: Ge 37:10 [[מה החלום הזה]] what is this dream which thou hast dreamt ? Ge 44:15, Jos 22:16, Ju Jdg 8:1, Jdg 15:11, Jdg 20:12, 1Sa 29:3 [[מָה הָעִבְרִים האלה]], 1Ki 9:13 [[מה העדים האלה אשׁר נתתה לי]], 2Ki 9:22, 2Ki 18:19.

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: [[מה]] is often used in questions to which the answer little, or nothing, is expected, and it thus becomes equivalent to a rhetorical negative (cf. [[הֲ]]

definitions.title: f
definitions.body: c): (a) Ge 23:15 land worth 400 shekels..., [[מה היא]] what is it ? (i.e. it is something quite insignificant), Ge 27:37, Ju Jdg 8:3 [[עשׂות ככם ומה־יכלתי]], Jdg 14:18, Ho 9:5, Ho 10:3, Ps 30:10, Ps 56:5, Job 15:9, Job 16:6, Job 21:21, Job 22:13, Job 22:17, La 2:13, Ct So 5:9 [[מַהאדּוֹדֵךְ מִדּוֹד]] what is thy beloved (more) than a(nother) beloved ? ‖[[לא]], 1Ki 12:16 [[מַה־לָּנוּ חֵלֶק בְּדָוֹד וְלאׁ־נַחֲלָה בְּבֶן יִשַׁי]] (2Sa 20:1 ´[[אֵין־לָנוּ חֵלֶק וג]]), Job 16:6. (b) sq. [[כִּי]] ([[כִּי]]

definitions.title: 1 f
definitions.body: ), Ge 20:9, Ge 37:26 [[מַה־בֶּחַע כִּי נַהֲרׂג]] what profit (is it) that we should slay him ? Ex 16:7, Nu 16:11, Hb Hab 2:18, 2Ki 8:13 what is thy servant, the dog, that he should do, etc.? and often in poetry, as Ps 8:5 [[מָה אנושׁ כי תזכרנו]] what is man that thou rememberest him ? Job 6:11 [[מַה־כּׂחִי כִּי אֲיַחֵל]] , v:Job 6:11 b, Job 7:17, Job 15:12 f; Job 15:14, Job 16:3, Job 21:15 + (cf. ´[[מִ]]

definitions.body: b). Hence, (c) in the formula of repudiation, or emphatic denial, ([[וְלָכֶם]]) [[מַה־לִּי וָלָךְ]] what is there (common) to me and to thee ? i.e. what have I to do with thee ? † Ju Jdg 11:12, 2Sa 16:10 [[מה לי ולכם]], 2Sa 19:23, 1Ki 17:18, 2Ki 3:13, 2Ch 35:21; cf. Jos 22:24, 2Ki 9:18, 2Ki 9:19; rather differently, without [[וְ]], † Je 2:18 ´[[מה לך לדרך מ]] what is there to thee with reference to the way to Egypt ? Ho 14:9 [[מַהאלּוֹ לַעֲחַבִּים]], cf. Ps 50:16 ([[לְסַפֵּר]]); with [[את]], † Je 23:28 [[מַה־לַתֶּבֶן אֶת־הַבָּר]] beside (or in comparison with) the wheat ? cf. ti/ e)moi\ (h(mi=n) kai\ soi/; Mt 8:29, Mk 5:7, Jn 2:4; and Ar. ma0 liy walahu

definitions.title: e.
definitions.body: = whatsoever (cf. [[מִי]]

definitions.title: g
definitions.body: ): (a) Ju Jdg 9:48 [[ראיתם עשׂיתי מהרו עשׂו כמוני מה אתם]], lit. what do you see (that) I have done ? hasten, and do like me (= whatever ye see, etc.), 2Sa 21:4 [[אעשׂה לכם מה אתם אמרים]], Job 6:24; with the apod. introd. by [[וְ]], 1Sa 20:4 [[מה תאמר נפשׁך ואעשׂה לך]]; Es 5:3 [[וְיִנָּתֵן לָךְ מַה־]]…[[בַּקָּשָׁתֵךְ]], v:Es 5:6, Es 7:2, Es 9:12; hence in the late and strange idiom of Ch., it sinks twice almost to the rel. what, 1Ch 15:13 [[כי לְמַבָּרִאשׁוֹנָה לא אתם]] because ye were not (employed) for what was at first (on the former occasion), J. etc., 2Ch 30:3 [[לְמַדַּי]] acc. to what was sufficient (= in sufficient numbers), cf. Es 9:26. (b) -[[מַה־שֶּׁ]] (late: frequently in Mishn., etc.), whatever, what (cf. [[מִי אֲשֶׁר]], [[מִי]]

definitions.title: g
definitions.body: end): † Ec 1:9 [[מַה־שֶּׁהָיָה הוּא שֶׁיִּהְיֶה]], lit. what is that which hath been ? it is that which shall be (= whatever hath been, it is that which shall be), v:Ec 1:9, Ec 3:15, Ec 3:22, Ec 6:10, Ec 7:24, Ec 8:7, Ec 10:14.
Used adverbially:

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: as an interrogative: (a) how ? especially in expressing what is regarded as an impossibility, Ge 44:16 [[מַה־נִּחְטַדָָּק]] how shall we justify ourselves ? Nu 23:8, Nu 23:8, 1Sa 10:27 [[מַה־יּשִׁעֵנוּ זֶה]], 2Ki 4:43, Job 9:2, Job 25:4, Job 25:4, Job 31:1 I made a covenant with my eyes, ´[[וּמָה אֶתְבּוֹנֵן עַל ב]] and how should I look upon a maid ? (LXX ou), Vulgate non), Pr 20:24 [[דַּרְכּוֹ וְאָדָם מַה־יָּבִין]]; in an indirect question, Ex 10:26, Ps 39:5 [[אֵֽדְעָה מֶה־חָדֵל אָָנִי]]; [[מַה־זֶּה]], how, now ? (in surprise), Ge 27:20 [[מַה־זֶּה מִהַרְתָּ לִמְחאׁ בְּנִי]], Ju Jdg 18:24, 1Ki 21:5, 2Ki 1:5. (b) why ? Ex 14:15 [[אֵלַי מַה תִּחְעַק]], Ex 17:2, Ex 17:2, 2Ki 6:33, 2Ki 7:3, Ps 42:6 [[מַה־תִּשְׁתּוֹחֲחִי עלי]], Job 15:12 + ; Ct So 8:4 I adjure you [[מַה־תָּעִירוּ וּמַה־תְּעוֹרֲרוּ]], why will ye stir up, etc.? (i.e. do not: ‖[[אִם]] So 2:7, So 3:5).—The transition from the interrog. to the neg., to which in Heb. there is an approx. (v. supr.: esp. 1Ki 12:16, Job 31:1, Ct So 8:4), is in Ar. complete, ma0 being there used constantly in the sense of not (cf. Walker:Hbr. xii. 244 ff.; Kö:iii, 478).

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: as an exclam., how ...! with adjectives and verbs, Ge 28:17 [[מַה־נּוֹרָא הַמָּקוֹם הַזֶּה]] how dreadful is this place! Ge 38:29, Nu 24:5 [[מַה־טּׂבוּ אׂהָלֶיְ]], Is 52:7, Ps 3:2 [[מה רבו]], Ps 8:2 [[מה אדיר]], Ps 21:2, Ps 36:8, etc., Ct So 4:10, So 4:10, So 7:2; ironically, 2Sa 6:20, Je 2:33, Je 2:36, Job 26:2, Job 26:3.

Indef. pron. anything, aught, Nu 23:3 [[וּדְבַר־מַה־יַּרְאֵנִי וְהִגַּדְתִּי לָָךְ]] and he will shew me the matter of aught, and I will tell thee (= if he shew me... I will, etc., Dr:§ 149), 1Sa 19:3 [[וְרָאִיתִי מָה וִהִגַּדְתִּי לָָךְ]] = and if I see aught, I will, etc., 1Sa 20:10 [[אוֹ מַה־יַּעַנִ ְאָבִי ְקָשָׁה]] if perchance thy father shall answer thee aught that is harsh (order,

Note especially (a) in expostulations, Ge 12:18 [[למה לא הגדת לי]] why didst thou not tell me, etc. ? v:Ge 12:19, Ge 29:25, Ge 31:27, Ge 42:1, Ge 43:6, 1Sa 21:15, 1Sa 22:13, 1Sa 24:10, Ps 22:2, Ps 44:24, Ps 44:25, Ps 74:1, Ps 74:11 + oft.; (b) with an impf., oft. deprecating, or introducing rhetorically, the reason why something should, or should not, be done, why should…? 1Sa 19:5, 1Sa 19:17, 1Sa 20:8 but to thy father (emph.)
